bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Robert C. Gooch, March 11, 1942

div1.p: Hench returns the journals he borrowed and will return the remaining one soon.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Robert C. Gooch, March 11, 1942
div1.opener:
me Hent #1.
March 11, 1942
Mr. R. C. Gooch
Library of Congress
Chief of the Book Services
Washington, D. C.
My dear Mr. Gooch:
div1.p:
Our library is returning by separate post
seven copies of the Boletin Clinico Mensual del Hospital
Numero Uno. I appreciate the loan of these greatly.
Would you permit me to send you the eighth copy, that
is, April, 1903, Volume 1, No. 4, in a few days? I am
having an article therein photostated and our photographic
department has been so busy that they have not yet been
able to finish it. I will return it to you as soon as
I can.
div1.closer: Very truly yours, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
